content.text:
# List of international presidential trips made by Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan

This is a list of international presidential trips made by Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan (MBZ), the 3rd president of the United Arab Emirates. He assumed the position officially on 14 May 2022, the death of his brother Khalifa, but held the role de facto since 2014.
List
2022
{| class="wikitable sortable"
! Country
! Areas visited
! Dates
! Details
|-
|
|Paris
|18-19 July
|Met with President Emmanuel Macron, witnessed the signing of an energy deal to replace French energy imports from Russia.
|-
|
|Athens
|25 August
|Met with President Katerina Sakellaropoulou.
|-
|
|Muscat
|27-28 September
|Met with Sultan Haitham bin Tariq.
|-
|
|Moscow
|11 October
|Met with President Vladimir Putin, discussed the Ukraine war and OPEC+ supply cuts.
|-
|rowspan="2" |
|Surakarta
|14 November
|Met president Jokowi and together inaugurated Sheikh Zayed Mosque
|-
|Bali
|15-16 November
|Attended The G20 Summit
|-
|
|Doha
|5 December
|Met with Emir of Qatar, Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani. This is the first visit after the end of the Qatar diplomatic crisis.
|}
2023
{| class="wikitable sortable"
! Country
! Areas visited
! Dates
! Details
|-
|
|Rahim Yar Khan
|25 January
|Met Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif.
|-
|
|Paris
|11 May
|Met with President Emmanuel Macron.
|-
|
|Istanbul
|10 June
|Met with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
|-
|
|St. Petersburg
|16 June
|Attended the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum. Met with President Vladimir Putin to discuss the Ukraine war.
|-
|
|Amman
|2 August
|Met with Jordanian King Abdulla II.
|-
|
|El Alamein
|7 August
|Met with President Abdel Fattah El-Sisi.
|-
|
|Addis Ababa
|18 August
|Met with Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed.
|-
|
|New Delhi
|9 September
|Attended the G20 Summit, where the UAE participated as a guest to discuss sustainable economic growth and climate action.
|-
|
|Doha
|2 October
|Met with Emir of Qatar, Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani and visited the 2023 International Horticultural Expo in Doha.
|-
|
|Riyadh
|20 October
|Met Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and attended the GCC-ASEAN Summit.
|-
|
|Cairo
|21 October
|Attended the Cairo Summit for Peace to de-escalate the Gaza war.
|}
2024
{| class="wikitable sortable"
! Country
! Areas visited
! Dates
! Details
|-
|
|Baku
|8 January
|Met with President Ilham Aliyev.
|-
|
|Gandhinagar
|9 January
|Attended the Vibrant Gujarat Global Summit. Met Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
|-
|
|Manama
|16 February
|Met with Bahraini King Hamad bim Isa Al Khalifa.
|-
|
|Seoul
|28-29 May
|Met with President Yoon Suk Yeol. Attended the signing of a bilateral trade agreement.
|-
|
|Beijing
|29-31 May
|Met with President Xi Jinping. Attended the China-Arab States Cooperation Forum.
|-
|
|Borgo Egnazia
|14 June
|Attended the G7 session on artificial intelligence (AI) and energy. Met with Prime Minister Georgia Meloni, and British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak.
|-
| rowspan="4" |
| rowspan="3" |Washington, D.C.
|23 September
|Met with President Joe Biden and Vice President and presidential candidate Kamala Harris, the visit was the first state visit of a sitting UAE president.
|-
|24 September
|Met with Secretary of State Antony Blinken and National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan.
|-
|25 September
|Met with Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo and members of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence.
|-
|Palm Beach, Florida
|26 September
|Met with former president Donald Trump, who was running for a second term in the 2024 United States presidential election.
|-
|
|Cairo
|3 October
|Met with President Abdel Fattah El-Sisi.
|-
|
|Belgrade
|5 October
|Met with President Aleksandar Vučić, attended the signing of a bilateral trade agreement
|-
|
|Amman
|6 October
|Met with King Abdullah II.
|-
|
|Moscow
|18 October
|Attended the BRICS summit, the first since the UAE joined the organization in January 2024.
|-
|
|Kuwait City
|10 November
|Met with Emir Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah.
|-
|
|Baku
|11 November
|Attended the COP 29 climate summit.
|}
2025
{| class="wikitable sortable"
! Country
! Areas visited
! Dates
! Details
|-
|
|Rahim Yar Khan
|5 January
|Met Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif.
|}
